#summary Running Datarace Checker and Experimental Results
#labels Featured

=== Toy Example ===

See the example in directory `chord/examples/datarace_test/` of the Chord 2.0 distribution. The `README` file in that directory explains how to run the datarace checker on the example. The datarace checker upon successful completion should produce files:
  * [http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.0/dataraces_by_fld.html dataraces_by_fld.html] and [http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.0/dataraces_by_obj.html dataraces_by_obj.html] using 0-CFA,
  * [http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.1/dataraces_by_fld.html dataraces_by_fld.html] and [http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.1/dataraces_by_obj.html dataraces_by_obj.html] using 1-object-sensitive alias analysis, and
  * [http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.2/dataraces_by_fld.html dataraces_by_fld.html] and [http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.2/dataraces_by_obj.html dataraces_by_obj.html] using 2-object-sensitive alias analysis.
